segment.source: Acquire apps in Windows Store for Business (Windows 10)
segment.target: Acquire apps in Windows Store for Business (Windows 10)

segment.source: As an admin, you can acquire apps from the Windows Store for Business for your employees.
segment.target: As an admin, you can acquire apps from the Windows Store for Business for your employees.

segment.source: Some apps are free, and some have a price.
segment.target: Some apps are free, and some have a price.

segment.source: For info on app types that are supported, see Apps in the Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: For info on app types that are supported, see Apps in the Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: Acquire apps in Windows Store for Business
segment.target: Acquire apps in Windows Store for Business

segment.source: As an admin, you can acquire apps from the Windows Store for Business for your employees.
segment.target: As an admin, you can acquire apps from the Windows Store for Business for your employees.

segment.source: Some apps are free, and some have a price.
segment.target: Some apps are free, and some have a price.

segment.source: For info on app types that are supported, see Apps in the Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: For info on app types that are supported, see Apps in the Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: App licensing model
segment.target: App licensing model

segment.source: The Business store supports two options to license apps: online and offline.
segment.target: The Business store supports two options to license apps: online and offline.

segment.source: Online licensing is the default licensing model and is similar to the Windows Store.
segment.target: Online licensing is the default licensing model and is similar to the Windows Store.

segment.source: Online licensed apps require users and devices to connect to the Store for Business service to acquire an app and its license.
segment.target: Online licensed apps require users and devices to connect to the Store for Business service to acquire an app and its license.

segment.source: Offline licensing is a new licensing option for Windows 10.
segment.target: Offline licensing is a new licensing option for Windows 10.

segment.source: With offline licenses, organizations can cache apps and their licenses to deploy within their network.
segment.target: With offline licenses, organizations can cache apps and their licenses to deploy within their network.

segment.source: ISVs or devs can opt-in their apps for offline licensing when they submit them to the developer center.
segment.target: ISVs or devs can opt-in their apps for offline licensing when they submit them to the developer center.

segment.source: For more information, see Apps in the Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: For more information, see Apps in the Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: Payment options
segment.target: Payment options

segment.source: Some apps are free, and some have a price.
segment.target: Some apps are free, and some have a price.

segment.source: Apps can be purchased in the Windows Store for Business using your credit card.
segment.target: Apps can be purchased in the Windows Store for Business using your credit card.

segment.source: You can enter your credit card information on Account Information, or when you purchase an app.
segment.target: You can enter your credit card information on Account Information, or when you purchase an app.

segment.source: Currently, we accept these credit cards:
segment.target: Currently, we accept these credit cards:

segment.source: VISA
segment.target: VISA

segment.source: MasterCard
segment.target: MasterCard

segment.source: Discover
segment.target: Discover

segment.source: American Express
segment.target: American Express

segment.source: Japan Commercial Bureau (JCB)
segment.target: Japan Commercial Bureau (JCB)

segment.source: Organization info
segment.target: Organization info

segment.source: There are a couple of things we need to know when you pay for apps.
segment.target: There are a couple of things we need to know when you pay for apps.

segment.source: You can add this info to the Account information page before you buy apps.
segment.target: You can add this info to the Account information page before you buy apps.

segment.source: If you haven’t provided it, we’ll ask when you make a purchase.
segment.target: If you haven’t provided it, we’ll ask when you make a purchase.

segment.source: Either way works.
segment.target: Either way works.

segment.source: Here’s the info you’ll need to provide:
segment.target: Here’s the info you’ll need to provide:

segment.source: Legal business address
segment.target: Legal business address

segment.source: Payment option (credit card)
segment.target: Payment option (credit card)

segment.source: You can add payment info on Account information.
segment.target: You can add payment info on Account information.

segment.source: If you don’t have one saved with your account, you’ll be prompted to provide one when you buy an app.
segment.target: If you don’t have one saved with your account, you’ll be prompted to provide one when you buy an app.

segment.source: Acquire apps
segment.target: Acquire apps

segment.source: To acquire an app
segment.target: To acquire an app

segment.source: Log in to http://businessstore.microsoft.com
segment.target: Log in to http://businessstore.microsoft.com

segment.source: Click Shop, or use Search to find an app.
segment.target: Click Shop, or use Search to find an app.

segment.source: Click the app you want to purchase.
segment.target: Click the app you want to purchase.

segment.source: On the product description page, choose your license type - either online or offline.
segment.target: On the product description page, choose your license type - either online or offline.

segment.source: Free apps will be added to Inventory.
segment.target: Free apps will be added to Inventory.

segment.source: For apps with a price, you can set the quantity you want to buy.
segment.target: For apps with a price, you can set the quantity you want to buy.

segment.source: Type the quantity and click Next.
segment.target: Type the quantity and click Next.

segment.source: If you don’t have a payment method saved in Account settings, Store for Business will prompt you for one.
segment.target: If you don’t have a payment method saved in Account settings, Store for Business will prompt you for one.

segment.source: Add your credit card or debit card info, and click Next.
segment.target: Add your credit card or debit card info, and click Next.

segment.source: Your card info is saved as a payment option on Account information.
segment.target: Your card info is saved as a payment option on Account information.

segment.source: You’ll also need to have your business address saved on Account information.
segment.target: You’ll also need to have your business address saved on Account information.

segment.source: The address is used to generate tax rates.
segment.target: The address is used to generate tax rates.

segment.source: For more information on taxes for apps, see organization tax information.
segment.target: For more information on taxes for apps, see organization tax information.

segment.source: Store for Business adds the app to your inventory.
segment.target: Store for Business adds the app to your inventory.

segment.source: From Inventory, you can:
segment.target: From Inventory, you can:

segment.source: Distribute the app: add to private store, or assign licenses
segment.target: Distribute the app: add to private store, or assign licenses

segment.source: View app licenses: review current licenses, reclaim and reassign licenses
segment.target: View app licenses: review current licenses, reclaim and reassign licenses

segment.source: View app details: review the app details page and purchase more licenses
segment.target: View app details: review the app details page and purchase more licenses

segment.source: For info on distributing apps, see Distribute apps to your employees from the Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: For info on distributing apps, see Distribute apps to your employees from the Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: For info on offline-licensed apps, see Distribute offline apps.
segment.target: For info on offline-licensed apps, see Distribute offline apps.
